node.title: Mum's lifelong struggles suddenly made sense when son received diagnosis
node.description: Helen Whitaker was 39 when her son's diagnosis of ADHD led to her own transformationalÂ medical discovery.
node.content:
["Mother-of-three Helen Whitaker had no idea she had attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) until her son received his diagnosis.", "Ms Whitaker, who lives in southern Tasmania, noticed some concerning behaviour in her eldest son and sought support.", "The assessment and diagnosis led to a surprising discovery that has transformed her life.", "\"I looked at the list of symptoms and thought, 'Oh goodness, that sounds like me',\" Ms Whitaker said.", "Earlier this year, Ms Whitaker was diagnosed with ADHD at the age of 39 and joined the 3 per cent of Australians who live with it.", "She said years of feelings of failure and self-doubt could suddenly be explained.", "\"There were tears, many tears,\" Ms Whitaker said.", "", "
Helen Whitaker's son's diagnosis came with a personal revelation.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
Gripped by anxiety
", "Ms Whitaker said she was a happy child who did well at school.", "She came from a supportive family, but said she carried an inexplicable feeling of shame that became worse as she approached her teenage years.", "\"My anxiety started to grow, I experienced low self-esteem, low self-worth and low self-efficacy,\" she said.", "", "
Ms\u00a0Whitaker says she used to not be able to concentrate on something like playing a card game with her children.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "The growing list of undiagnosed symptoms led her to believe that she was not good enough and was a failure.", "In motherhood, feelings of anxiety\u00a0were explained away by the demands of parenting young children and poor organisation.", "\"There's a lot of talk amongst mothers about how hard, difficult and tiring it can be,\" Ms Whitaker said.", "", "
Ms\u00a0Whitaker says her diagnosis explains the feelings of anxiety she's had over the years.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
A common story
", "Ms Whitaker's story is one ADHD consultant and clinical psychologist Maddi Derrick is all too familiar with.", "She is a consultant and a parent whose own ADHD diagnosis also came about through the diagnosis of her son.", "Dr Derrick describes it as a penny-drop moment when parents stumble across the information in search of answers for their child.", "\"It's what set me on this path in my clinical practice, I started to notice some struggles my eldest son was having and doing the research led me to realise what was happening for him, but also for myself,\" she said.", "Dr Derrick said between 40 and\u00a060 per cent of children with ADHD have at least one parent with the condition.", "She said only about 10 per cent of Australian adults with ADHD have a diagnosis, and\u00a0only 0.7 per cent are being dispensed medication for ADHD despite an estimated 3\u00a0per cent of the adult population living with the condition.", "Overwhelmingly, women fly under the radar.", "\"The symptoms look a little different for girls and all of the tools and diagnostic criteria we use to assess ADHD is all based around how it looks in boys,\" she said.", "", "
Maddi Derrick said her experience was similiar to Ms Whitaker's.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
Symptoms and treatment
", "ADHD symptoms can change in severity over the course of a person's life.", "For women, the symptoms can become more obvious after puberty and can worsen after having children and in the lead-up to menopause.", "Dr Derrick said adults tended to develop coping mechanisms, but those could lead to exhaustion, burnout and anxiety.", "Best practice treatment for ADHD includes medication and non-pharmacological treatment like psychological intervention.", "Dr Derrick said that while medication could help with ADHD symptoms, other forms of treatment would aid the management of symptoms and help to improve wellbeing.", "Ms Whitaker has been treated through a combination of medication and non-pharmacological support.", "\"The medication enables me to utilise the strategies I've learned,\" Ms Whitaker said.", "\"They work together\u00a0and I need both to be a happy, successful person.", "", "
Helen Whitker's son says the condition has its benefits.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
The positives of ADHD
", "ADHD has not been a wholly negative experience for Ms Whitaker and her son.", "\"It gives me the ability to focus on something I love doing and I can work on it non-stop,\" her son said.", "Ms Whitaker associates\u00a0focus, drive and determination\u00a0with\u00a0the disorder, along with bravery and a fearlessness when it comes to going against the norm.", "\"If I want to do something, then I generally will do it,\" she said."]
